meanings.definition: Scraveling (adjective): messy or untidy in appearance
meanings.sent1: The scraveling room was filled with scattered toys and clothes.
meanings.sent2: Her hair looked scraveling after playing outside in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The scraveling desk seemed to have a mind of its own, always cluttered.
meanings.sent4: The garden was a scraveling canvas of wildflowers and overgrown grass.
meanings.sent5: The old house had a charmingly scraveling exterior, with peeling paint and crooked shutters.

meanings.definition: Scraveling (noun): a person who is unkempt or disheveled
meanings.sent1: The scraveling at the bus stop caught everyone's attention with his wild hair.
meanings.sent2: She felt like a scraveling after a long day of hiking in the mountains.
meanings.sent3: The scraveling in the mirror made her burst into laughter at her messy appearance.
meanings.sent4: He was a scraveling in the world of fashion, always wearing mismatched clothes.
meanings.sent5: The movie character was portrayed as a lovable scraveling, with tousled hair and a carefree attitude.

meanings.definition: Scraveling (verb): to make something messy or untidy
meanings.sent1: The kids managed to scraveling the living room in just a few minutes.
meanings.sent2: Please don't scraveling the papers on my desk, I just organized them.
meanings.sent3: She playfully scraveled the sandcastle they had just built at the beach.
meanings.sent4: The wind seemed to scraveling the leaves all over the yard, creating a mess.
meanings.sent5: His attempt to cook dinner ended up scraveling the kitchen with flour and sauce splatters.
